page.title: 12Shouldham-A day at school.1
page.content: {A day in the Junior Class at Shouldham School starts at 9a.m. when one child rings the bell. This bell is as old as the school and is dated 1866. It is hung in the south gable. We line up in our classes and then go in. The register is called first and then the dinner register. We bring dinner money on a Monday and it is Â£3.10 per week.We also bring 10p for school fund and this money pays for our outings and Christmas party. Next follows prayers where we are given a short talk or told a story, sing a hymn and say a prayer. We all join together on Wednesdays and Fridays and the vicar comes in to take prayers about once a month. Each day we begin with class maths where we all work together. Mr.Swift uses the blackboard and we have a different topic each week.
